page.title: 19OTHER HAILSHAM CHURCHES
page.content: The present{Methodist Church}was built in{1868.}Amongst many activities, the Minister and Choir provide a monthly service which is recorded for the blind. The tapes are distributed throughout the parish and to the East Sussex "Casettes For The Blind". It is also used by the luncheon club for elderly people, Brownies and Girl Guides, the Women's Fellowship, an evening club for young wives and youth clubs. The{Hailsham Free Church}also provides a wide range of activities for the community. These include the Boys Brigade who have a band, Bible Classes and craft evenings, Girl Covenanters, Sunday school,Oasis (for women),a woman's fellowship and a mothers'and toddlers group. They also record services for the housebound.
